events.target_title: Several improvements that could be done!
Undefined behavior in io-jpeg.c
GIMP doesn't properly remove image data when an alpha channel is supported
Cannot read files with FTP mounted filesystem on Linux >= 5.4

note.body:
I can confirm this issue is happening to me as well, I first noticed when trying to edit files via Thunar (Open with Mousepad) and nothing happened. Same issue occurred trying to use emacs. Upon further inspection, the operation was actually crashing and generated a core dump. In certain apps (like Atom) it would just not open at all, Atom would show an error via it's console. However, file editing would work fine with Geany for some reason. This also had the same behavior when I tried it in Nautilus when trying to edit as well.

I originally started a thread over at XFCE.org before I was linked here, pointing this out to be a GVFS issue with Kernels >= 5.4. I am also on Arch Linux. Using any Kernel 5.3x or earlier, the issue does not occur.

"contents returned by g_mapped_file_get_contents seem invalid."

"Program terminated with signal SIGBUS, Bus error."

Crash dump and more info that may be of use from my XFCE posting:
[https://bugzilla.xfce.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16357](https://bugzilla.xfce.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16357)

events.target_title: tracker-miner-fs eating my CPU
tracker-miner-fs eating my CPU
tracker-miner-fs eating my CPU

note.body:
Thanks for your reply,

I think the miner should start when I am not using my CPU, like 1-10%. Still, when I work on many things, as you can see, it is trying to index them at the same time, I build pieces of stuff like nodeJS libraries or generated Android build.
I think it should wait and resume its job when the CPU not in load.
It has lesser priority, which means the CPU will execute that process less often (whenever it gets an opportunity).

`tracker daemon status`

![Screenshot_from_2020-01-12_16-42-14](/uploads/3b433787d34bc8f879a87ed07f68b956/Screenshot_from_2020-01-12_16-42-14.png)

events.target_title: Multi-seat support broken in 3.34.1

note.body:
I upgraded Fedora 30 to Fedora 31. Both multiseat and VNC stopped working.

I have two seats: seat0 and seat1 on the same WS. When I boot up my WS two login screen appears.
I can log in at seat0 and open the gnome session. But when another user tries to log in at seat1, no password screen appeared and the first user session at seat0 terminates.

If there are no users logged in at the seats and some user tries to open a network VNC connection, he can see the GDM login screen and enter the password. But his graphical gnome session starts at seat0 instead of network VNC.

I think the basic idea of changes in 3.34 that any user can have only one graphical session contradicts to the current multiseat and VNC implementation.

In a multiseat environment (in Fedora 30, because it does not work in F31)

loginctl

SESSION  UID USER SEAT  TTY 

      3 1001 oleg seat0 tty2

     c1   42 gdm  seat0 tty1

     c2   42 gdm  seat1     

3 sessions listed.


When someone opens a VNC network connection a new gdm session appears:

loginctl

SESSION  UID USER SEAT  TTY 

      3 1001 oleg seat0 tty2

     c1   42 gdm  seat0 tty1

     c2   42 gdm  seat1     

     c3   42 gdm            

4 sessions listed.


And when the user logs in to VNC, the session of gdm disappears and the session of the new user appears:

loginctl

SESSION  UID USER    SEAT  TTY 

      3 1001 oleg    seat0 tty2

      5 1002 larissa           

     c1   42 gdm     seat0 tty1

     c2   42 gdm     seat1     

4 sessions listed.

GIMP 2.10.8 crashes on LUbuntu, the error was 'BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)'.
GIMP 2.10.8 crashes on LUbuntu, the error was 'BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)'.

note.body:
*  GIMP version: 2.10.8
*  Operating System: LUbuntu 19.04 (Linux)
*  Package: apt package
*  Other System infos: 
  *  Dual core 2Ghz, 3 GB RAM
  *  VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82945G/GZ Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02)
  *  Desktop on LUbuntu is LxQT/Openbox, and i'm running XCompmgr.

# Description of the bug
```
:~$ gimp-2.10 
gimp_color_transform_new: using babl for 'sRGB IEC61966-2.1' -> 'GIMP built-in sRGB'
gimp_color_transform_new: using babl for 'sRGB IEC61966-2.1' -> 'GIMP built-in sRGB'
void gimp_gegl_convert_color_profile(GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GimpColorRenderingIntent, gboolean, GimpProgress*): converting buffer took 0,7013 seconds
gimp_color_transform_new: using babl for 'sRGB IEC61966-2.1' -> 'GIMP built-in sRGB'
void gimp_gegl_convert_color_profile(GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GimpColorRenderingIntent, gboolean, GimpProgress*): converting buffer took 1,5797 seconds
The program 'gimp-2.10' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)'.
  (Details: serial 230643 error_code 3 request_code 18 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)

(script-fu:1839): LibGimpBase-WARNING **: 12:18:04.406: script-fu: gimp_wire_read(): error
```

# Reproduction
Load few images and doing simple copy or square selections and switch from
1 image to another, the application crash. Happens with only 2 images loaded sometimes,
quite often.

Is the bug reproducible? [Always / Randomly / Happened only once ]
Randomly, but happens quite often here.

Reproduction steps:

1. Load some pictures
2. Do some simple manipulations, copy/paste, square selections, move layers...
3. switch between loaded images

…

Expected result:
Don't crash.

Actual result:
Crash.

# Additional information

Nothing in /var/crash/.

I added some of the images i was using in the "attach file section",
Maybe the one that has a layer is usefull..., that's the only image with
layers i'm using, i tried several time with this setup, crash very often.

Also the Windows version 2.8.* on the same machine works perfectly with
thoses same files, doing the same manipulations, no crash.

If you have a backtrace for a crash or a warning, paste it here.
Already pasted before, bug again:

```
:~$ gimp-2.10 
gimp_color_transform_new: using babl for 'sRGB IEC61966-2.1' -> 'GIMP built-in sRGB'
gimp_color_transform_new: using babl for 'sRGB IEC61966-2.1' -> 'GIMP built-in sRGB'
void gimp_gegl_convert_color_profile(GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GimpColorRenderingIntent, gboolean, GimpProgress*): converting buffer took 0,7013 seconds
gimp_color_transform_new: using babl for 'sRGB IEC61966-2.1' -> 'GIMP built-in sRGB'
void gimp_gegl_convert_color_profile(GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GeglBuffer*, const GeglRectangle*, GimpColorProfile*, GimpColorRenderingIntent, gboolean, GimpProgress*): converting buffer took 1,5797 seconds
The program 'gimp-2.10' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)'.
  (Details: serial 230643 error_code 3 request_code 18 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)

(script-fu:1839): LibGimpBase-WARNING **: 12:18:04.406: script-fu: gimp_wire_read(): error
```

events.target_title: External subtitles do not work with LG Smart TV

note.body:
Hmmm...
Is there still no solution to this problem?

miniDLNA supports srt files so I don't have to implement something else, but... Ubuntu 19.10 has built-in DLNA/UPnP AV services offered by rygel package. It can be easily enabled via System Settings utility. It would be great to solve this problem because users would not have to install other software.

events.target_title: External subtitles do not work with LG Smart TV

note.body:
I build rygel from the most recent code on https://github.com/GNOME/rygel.
I can confirm that external subtitles (separate .srt files) now work on LG TV.
Thanks, great job Jens Georg!

events.target_title: Menus drop down problem

note.body:
Experiencing similar in Gimp 2.10.14 on Windows 10. In my case it only happens if Gimp is used on the lower monitor (primary display) of an extended monitor setup (2 monitors arranged vertically)

All menus drop down except for **Edit, View, Colors**

If I switch the theme to the System theme from within Preferences the issue disappears.

Will check to see if the same happens in Ubuntu and MacOS.

events.target_title: Menus drop down problem

note.body:
Correct the problem is not there if the screen arrangement is horizontal (see below - Light theme selected - Gimp on primary monitor).

The problem does not replicate itself in Ubuntu with the screens arranged vertically (have not as yet tried MacOS)

I find the menu unusable on the lower monitor - but it is not a great issue, as personally I prefer to use the System theme, in which case the menus all display perfectly!

Sound crackling with lollypop. Fine with other audio players

note.body:
Equalizer is not enabled.

I've tried with ubuntu 19.10 and it plays fine with lollypop (version 1.1.4.16-4).
So I've built lollypop 1.1.4.16 on ArchLinux and the artifact is gone.

I will bissect between the releases first.

I've also tried different headphones, but I can still hear it.

The artifact is subtle, but I've made another friend listen to the sample and he was able to hear it on my computers. I've also tried different headphones. At least it's not my ears !

events.target_title: [Dark Mode] Text of selected items is too dark when window is in focus
[Dark Mode] Text of selected items is too dark when window is in focus

note.body:
I think you are right, I reset my GTK settings and everything appears to be working properly now.  Thanks for the suggestion that it may be a KDE and GTK issue rather than a lollypop one, and sorry for the spurious bug report.

For anyone else running into a similar issue on KDE Plasma, I reset my GTK-3 config by simply renaming `~/.config/gtk-3.0` to `~/.config/gtk-3.0.bak` and then I relaunched lollypop.

events.target_title: Flip Vertically for Export as DDS
sushi not starting ("The name :1.56 was not provided by any .service files")
GIMP Crashes when opening jpg file
Tif files with multiple layers gets merged by default

note.body:
I'd like to offer a solution for future viewers even though this is 2 months old. I found this thread after having the same exact issue with Sketchbook and GIMP and Googling it, so someone else will too.

At least for Sketchbook, I figured out a solution. Similar software might have the same capability. 

Save the file as "*.psd". Saving as "Photoshop TIFF" does not work, nor does saving as "TIFF" (default). 

The photo shows the GIMP Import dialogue. "boxes.tif" is default TIFF, "boxes1.tif" is Photoshop TIFF. You can see that it detects 9 layers in the psd. ![layers](/uploads/e919f4ecf9f2680d3e63abd37c0d9f13/layers.PNG)

events.target_title: Make forecasts show high and low temperatures for each day
Add new blue based style. Thanks to Will Farrington.

note.body: line 34 has a name of neon_pink but the colour is a yellow. 'value="#ffdd00"' should probably have been 'value="#ff00dd"'

events.target_title: Add new blue based style. Thanks to Will Farrington.

note.body:
Jeffery and Christian

I'm happy to leave it to you to decide whether to change the name or the
colour.

For your interest. I've used the cobalt style for years but one annoying
aspect of it was/is html special characters, e.g. /“/, which I
found hard to read (maybe age related :-)). After a bit of investigating
I discovered these are displayed in the XML Style - /xml:entity/ which
was set to /#blue/. I changed it to /neon_pink/ and it showed up as
yellow. I decided the color value was wrong so created my own copy of
cobalt.xml and changed /neon_pink/ to /#ff00dd/ and /xml:entity/ to
/neon_pink.

/Kind regards

Angus
//

events.target_title: g_io_channel_read_line does not honour the line_term symbols set
Copied text from rich text editors seems to be stored in the clipboard as a bitmap in X11

note.body: Merging !939 may result in a better default if text is available from the clipboard, but it will *not* resolve this issue. A clipboard manager should not suppress available types and offer a subset or request some "best type" and hand that over before a target application decided about the format it wants to paste.
